admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The Turkey Antalya Forest Utilization
            Project's primary objective was to make more intensive
            use of Turkey's forest resources to supply the growing
            need for Kraft packaging paper and board and for sawn wood.
            This objective was not fully realized because Turkey needed
            to be introduced to the concept of an integrated forest
            products industry which would allow optimum utilization of
            the forest. This required a major change in procedures in
            forest harvesting and marketing of the logs which was not
            fully accomplished. Another lesson learned was that the Bank
            was too optimistic on implementation and disbursements
            schedule. Most of the delay was due to a general
            deterioration of Turkey's economy during the period,
            lack of local and foreign funds, and slowdown by suppliers
            and contractors due to nonpayment. Another concern was the
            major item of equipment, the chemical recovery boiler, which
            was chiefly responsible for about two years' delay in
            project completion. This stemmed from the fact that the
            equipment was produced locally for the first time. While
            Bank projects should certainly encourage local manufacturing
            of equipment where appropriate, in a case such as this,
            involving fairly sophisticated technology, it is important
            to ensure adequate technical assistance is also provided.
